abstract_summ: The estimation method also accounts for the underreporting due to low case ascertainment by estimating the percentage of symptomatic cases using delay adjusted case fatality ratio based on the distribution of the delay from hospitalization to death.As the number of deaths rapidly increases worldwide, we encourage more sophisticated modelling of the epidemic based on the dynamics of death cases by experts in the field.Hence, calibrating model parameters for this virus's dynamics should not be done based only on confirmed case counts (without rescaling by the number of tests), but take also fatalities and hospitalization count under consideration as variables not prone to be distorted by testing efforts.Hence, calibrating model parameters for this virus’s dynamics should not be done based only on confirmed case counts (without rescaling by the number of tests), but take also fatalities and hospitalization count under consideration as variables not prone to be distorted by testing efforts.As the COVID-19 outbreak is developing the two most frequently reported statistics seem to be the raw confirmed case and case fatalities counts.
title_summ: Estimating the number of COVID-19-related infections, deaths and hospitalizations in Iran under different physical distancing and isolation scenarios: A compartmental mathematical modelingDetermination of daily reproduction numbers of SARS-CoV2 based on death cases suggests more rapid initial spread in Italy and the United StatesRisk of secondary infection waves of COVID-19 in an insular region: the case of the Balearic Islands, SpainAccounting for underreporting in mathematical modelling of transmission and control of COVID-19 in IranModest effects of contact reduction measures on the reproduction number of SARS-CoV-2 in the most affected European countries and the USAre official confirmed cases and fatalities counts good enough to study the COVID-19 pandemic dynamics?A critical assessment through the case of ItalyCovid-19: Data analysis of the Lombardy region and the provinces of Bergamo and BresciaEstimation of COVID-19 under-reporting in Brazilian States through SARIEstimation of the actual disease occurrence based on official case numbers during a COVID outbreak in Germany 2020Forecasting COVID-19-Associated Hospitalizations under Different Levels of Social Distancing in Lombardy and Emilia-Romagna, Northern Italy: Results from an Extended SEIR Compartmental ModelAre official confirmed cases and fatalities counts good enough to study the COVID-19 pandemic dynamics?A critical assessment through the case of ItalyTodesfälle in neunThe spread of COVID-19 in six western metropolitan regions: a false myth on the excess of mortality in Lombardy and the defense of the city of Milan.„Mortalitäts-Exzess-Lupe“ für SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19-Epidemiologie in Deutschland
title_abstract_phrases: The estimation method also accounts for the underreporting due to low case ascertainment by estimating the percentage of symptomatic cases using delay adjusted case fatality ratio based on the distribution of the delay from hospitalization to death.Determination of daily reproduction numbers of SARS-CoV2 based on death cases suggests more rapid initial spread in Italy and the United StatesPopulation density, behaviour and cultural habits strongly influence the spread of pathogens.As the number of deaths rapidly increases worldwide, we encourage more sophisticated modelling of the epidemic based on the dynamics of death cases by experts in the field.A critical assessment through the case of ItalyAs the COVID-19 outbreak is developing the two most frequently reported statistics seem to be the raw confirmed case and case fatalities counts.A critical assessment through the case of ItalyAs the COVID-19 outbreak is developing the two most frequently reported statistics seem to be the raw confirmed case and case fatalities counts.
